sentence: Pepsi ( PEP ) and Procter & Gamble ( PG ) shares rose after the consumer giants reported quarterly results, lifting sector exchange traded funds that count the stocks as top holdings.
At the end of the first quarter, Procter & Gamble was the largest holding in Vanguard Consumer Staples ETF (NYSEArca: VDC) at 12.4%.
Pepsi was number five in the ETF at 7%.
Pepsi shares were up nearly 3% in afternoon trading Thursday.

Pepsi "delivered quite solid results in the first quarter, and if it can sustain its momentum over the next few quarters, we think our investment thesis-that the multiple gap with Coca-Cola ( KO ) should close-may soon play out," said Morningstar's Philip Gorham in a report on the earnings.
"Pepsi appears on track to meet our estimate of mid- to high-single-digit earnings growth in 2011, and we are maintaining our $76 fair value estimate and long-term outlook," he added.
"Trading at 15 times 2011 earnings, Pepsi is an undervalued stock in an industry that could provide a safe haven if investors turn defensive over the next few months, in our opinion."
